item.description:
From the MFA website:

Chernobyl Heart by Maryann De Leo (2003, 39 min.). Sixteen years after the worst nuclear accident in history, award-winning filmmaker Maryann De Leo takes her camera back to ground zero, following the devastating effects of radiation on hospitals, orphanages, asylums, and evacuated villages. Interview with Mai Lai Veterans by Joseph Strick (1971, 20 min.). A Note of Triumph: The Golden Age of Norman Corwin by Eric Simonson (2005, 39 min.). Featuring interviews with Robert Altman, Norman Lear, Studs Terkel, and Walter Cronkite, A Note of Triumph: The Golden Age of Norman Corwin examines the greatest radio presentation in the history of the medium and shows how it remains eerily prescient in light of current events. Discussion and book signing with director follows February 17 screening.
